page.title: 11 Health in Weaverthorpe
page.content: The most usual ailments are sore throats, colds, coughs and other minor illnesses caused by viruses. Some years there is a small epidemic of chickenpox or mumps, which are usually confined to children, who recover quickly.The number of cases of allergy -related illnesses is increasing. When people are ill, most use the {general-practitioner group}based at {Sherburn and Rillington. Surgeries}are held in these villages every day except Sunday, and additional ones in some of the smaller villages. At Weaverthorpe there are three each week and one baby clinic each month, all held in the{Village Hall.} {Hospital}cases attend Scarborough, Malton, Driffield, Bridlington and Hull. People visit{dentists}and {opticians}in these towns and at Hunmanby.
